Trump has been fixated on coverage of Paul Manafort during his "working vacation," expressing his rage to close confidants that his former campaign chairman's trial is dominating news coverage.

Slamming Attorney General Jeff Sessions for being "scared stiff and Missing in Action," Trump later seized on a line of his attacks his allies have made on a separate Justice Department official in recent days.

Nellie Ohr reportedly worked for Fusion GPS, the organization that hired Christopher Steele to compile his dossier on the president's ties to Russia and was paid indirectly by Hilary Clinton's campaign.
